data.text: We use different means or modes of transport to move from one place to another.
Some vehicles are pulled by engines; some are pulled by animals.
Aeroplanes and helicopters fly in the air. Aeroplanes cover longer distances, while helicopters are used for shorter distances.
Trains and cars travel on land.
Ships and boats move on water.
Both trains and ships carry people as well as goods from one place to another.
Vehicles such as cars, trucks, buses, and motorcycles help us move on land.
